sub_topic: Finding the volume of a sphere inscribed in a cube.
message_1: A cube has an edge length of 10 cm. What is the volume of a sphere inscribed in the cube?
message_2:
A sphere inscribed in a cube will have its diameter equal to the edge length of the cube. In this case, the diameter of the sphere is 10 cm. The radius of the sphere will be half of the diameter, which is 5 cm.

The volume of a sphere is given by the formula:

V = (4/3)πr^3

where V is the volume, r is the radius, and π (pi) is a mathematical constant approximately equal to 3.14159.

Substituting the given radius into the formula:

V = (4/3)π(5)^3
V = (4/3)π(125)
V = (500/3)π

Approximating the value of π:

V ≈ (500/3) * 3.14159
V ≈ 523.598

So, the volume of the sphere inscribed in the cube is approximately 523.598 cubic centimeters.
